text: Aspergillus paleaceus (also named Neosartorya stramenia) is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Fumigati section. The species was first described in 1985.1985\. Advances in Penicillium and Aspergillus Systematics. :1-483 It has been reported to produce quinolactacin and avenaciolide. ==Growth and morphology== A. paleaceus has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_paleaceus_cya.png|Aspergillus paleaceus growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_paleaceus_meaox.png|Aspergillus paleaceus growing on MEAOX plate == References == paleaceus Category:Fungi described in 1985
title: Aspergillus paleaceus
